Procs

proc `!=`(a, b: Roman): bool {....raises: [], tags: [].}
proc `$`(r: Roman): string {....raises: [], tags: [].}

Example:

var rt = 20.toRoman
doAssert $rt == "XX"
proc `*=`(a: var Roman; b: int) {....raises: [KeyError, ValueError], tags: [].}

proc `+=`(a: var Roman; b: int) {....raises: [KeyError, ValueError], tags: [].}

Example:

var rnf = 20.toRoman
rnf += 2151
doAssert $rnf == "MMCLXXI"
doAssert rnf == 2171.toRoman

Example:

var firstroman = "XXXV".toRoman
var secondroman = 120.toRoman
doAssert secondroman > firstroman

proc arabic(r: Roman): int {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Same as int 
proc arabicToRoman(n: int): string {....raises: [KeyError, ValueError], tags: [].}
Converts an interger (> 0) to a roman string.

Example:

var roman = arabicToRoman(24)
doAssert roman == "XXIV"
proc int(r: Roman): int {....raises: [], tags: [].}
proc newRoman(): Roman {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Generates a new Roman [arabic:0, roman: ""].

Example:

var newr = newRoman()
newr += 1
newr *= 10

doAssert "X" == $newr
proc roman(r: Roman): string {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Same as $ 
proc romanToArabic(s: string): int {....raises: [ValueError], tags: [].}
Converts a roman string to an int.

Example:

var arabic = romanToArabic("XXXV")
doAssert arabic == 35
proc romanToArabic(s: string; caseSensitive: bool): int {....raises: [ValueError],
    tags: [].}
Converts a roman string to an int. Checks that cases are uniform. 
proc toRoman(n: int): Roman {....raises: [KeyError, ValueError], tags: [].}
Converts an integer to the Roman type.

Example:

var roman = 33.toRoman
doAssert roman.roman == "XXXIII"
proc toRoman(s: string): Roman {....raises: [ValueError], tags: [].}
Converts a roman string to the Roman type.

Example:

var romantype = "XXXV".toRoman
doAssert romantype.arabic == 35
romantype = "ii".toRoman
doAssert romantype.arabic == 2
doAssert romantype.roman == "II"
proc useRomanCache(state: bool = true; clear: bool = true) {.
    ...raises: [KeyError, ValueError], tags: [].}
Enable/disable and generates/clears searchable tables for roman / arabic numerals for values 1..999. Can be used for > 1000 (for their basis).

Example:

import romannumerals
useRomanCache()
